Event.name: Piracy
Event.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame describe situations in which a <fen>Perpetrator</fen> forcibly seizes control over a <fen>Victim</fen>'s <fen>Vehicle</fen> to gain some end. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Perp">French farmers</fex> have <t>hijacked</t> <fex name="Vehicle">a lorry</fex> and destroyed its load of strawberries.</ex>
<ex>But <fex name="Perp">attackers</fex> have <t>hijacked</t> <fex name="Vehicle">cars waiting at traffic lights and road junctions</fex> <fex name="Means">by simply opening the passenger door, jumping in and forcing the driver to a more deserted area</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Perpetrator
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is the person (or other agent) who forcibly seizes control over a vehicle to gain some end.</def-root>

Arg.name: Vehicle
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is the means of transportation which gets under the control of the perpetrator. Example: The terrorists hijacked <fex name="Vehicle">the plane</fex>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Victim
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the people that are suffering as a result of the <fen>Perpetrator</fen>'s action. <ex>The rebels skyjacked a plane <fex name="Victim">with 89 passangers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Event
Arg.definition: <def-root>The unlawful seizure of a <fen>Vehicle</fen> by a <fen>Perpetrator</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act performed by the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> by which the seizure of the <fen>Vehicle</fen> is accomplished.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing.</def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is the place to which the vehicle is directed.</def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is the place from which the vehicle is taken away.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The action that the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> is trying to accomplish by piracy.
<ex>We have <t>hijacked</t> this plane <fex name="Purpose">just to show how easy it is</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The situation that the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> had in mind which lead to the decision to perpetrate the particular act of piracy.
<ex>He <t>carjacked</t> the Lincoln Towncar instead <fex name="exp">because it looked ritzier</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An object that the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> uses in taking control of the <fen>Vehicle</fen>.
<ex>The plane was <t>hijacked</t> <fex name="Instrument">with knives</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The number of times that the <t>Vehicle</t> is seized in acts of piracy.
<ex>The ferry that Kenneth was on was <t>hijacked</t> <fex name="Frequency">twice</fex> in three days</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: hijack.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: illegally seize control of (an aircraft, ship, or vehicle) while in transit.

lexUnit.name: hijacking.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act or instance of being illegally seized (as an aircraft, ship, or vehicle) while in transit

lexUnit.name: hijacker.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: one who illegally seizes control of (an aircraft, ship, or vehicle) while in transit

lexUnit.name: carjacking.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of stealing a car after violently ejecting its driver.

lexUnit.name: hijacked.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: having been illegally seized (as an aircraft, ship, or vehicle) while in transit

lexUnit.name: piracy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the practice of attacking and robbing ships at sea, or a similar practice in other contexts, especially hijacking.

lexUnit.name: carjack.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: steal someone's car while they are driving it.
